Title: 🖼 WhatsApp, Skype and 9 other services were included in the regi...
Description: WhatsApp, Skype and 9 other services were included in the register of information dissemination organizers. This will allow the FSB to demand from the messenger access to user correspondenceThe decision was made by Roskomnadzor on December 19, to which Roskomsvoboda drew's attention. According to Russian legislation, services included in this register are required to transfer user data, including their correspondence, to the Federal Security Service upon request.The same list includes the DUST mobile application, the Armenian mobile messenger -Pinngle Safe Messenger- , Swiss communication service Status, Keybase application, American messenger Trillian, German encrypted messenger Crypviser, anonymous decentralized Session messenger, South Korean instant messaging application KakaoTalk, free cross-platform messenger using end-to-end encryption Element and Swiss Wire.It is not yet clear how actively WhatsApp and other instant messengers will cooperate with Russian authorities, and whether they are aware of their entry into the register. Roskomsvoboda hopes that these services will soon clarify the situation.

Title: 🎬🖼 The buildings of 6 diplomatic missions and the Church of St....
Description: The buildings of 6 diplomatic missions and the Church of St. Nicholas in Kyiv were damaged as a result of Russian shelling In the morning, Russia attacked the capital of Ukraine with five Iskander-M ballistic missiles. Launches like reports the headquarters of the Air Force of Ukraine, were produced from the Voronezh and Bryansk regions. Title: 🖼 -You are unworthy to be citizens of the Czech Republic-. Czech...
Description: -You are unworthy to be citizens of the Czech Republic.- Czech deputies have restricted Russians from obtaining citizenship.The Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Parliament, in the third final reading, adopted a bill that actually prohibits Russians from obtaining Czech citizenship. Exceptions are outstanding figures of sports and art, as well as individual humanitarian cases.Consideration of applications for citizenship from Russians over 15 years of age is suspended for those applications that have already been submitted.The bill was criticized representatives of the Russian diaspora and human rights organizations, pointing out that the conditions put forward are virtually unenforceable, since it is impossible to renounce Russian citizenship without having citizenship of another country. Also, critics of the bill called it discriminatory and pointed out that a significant number of people live in the Czech Republic who left Russia due to disagreement with the war and the power of Vladimir Putin. Now the Russians, who signed the petition about the inadmissibility of the adoption of the bill, are preparing to file a lawsuit with the intention, if necessary, to reach the ECHR.To obtain citizenship, it was necessary to live in the country for more than 10 years and fulfill a number of conditions. Now the document will be sent for consideration to the Senate. After the document is approved there, it will be sent to the President of the Czech Republic for signature. The amendment is expected to come into force in early February 2025. It was included in the Lex Ukrajina law, which provides for the extension of the temporary protection regime for Ukrainian refugees until 2026.ASTRA spoke with a girl who applied for citizenship back in April 2023 - her application has not yet been considered It is unlikely that they will even consider it now. Svetlana Bogdanova moved to Prague from Murmansk and works as a veterinarian.-It’s sad, of course, because you seem to live in the country, pay taxes, the country lives on these taxes, and then it just considers you a second person varieties and says: -No, you are not worthy to be a citizen of the Czech Republic.- It turns out that in a European country the same thing is happening as in Russia, that is, you can basically do whatever you want, and nothing will happen to you for it,- says Svetlana.She noted that she did not know what to do now. Among the options she is considering is moving to another country.

Title: 🖼 -The scale is catastrophic-. Residents of Anapa are eliminatin...
Description: -The scale is catastrophic.- Residents of Anapa are eliminating the consequences of tanker crashes on their ownASTRA spoke with volunteers who spent the whole day cleaning the beach in Anapa. They claim that, at least in their city, only they and local Cossacks removed oil products from the beach - the Emergency Situations Ministry employees did not help them.-They bought everything themselves, brought it in cars. Someone bought, for example, just a huge number of 120-liter basins. There are many people willing, but there is no equipment, not even clothes. Because we also went and realized that we had simply gotten away with everything. People are all standing in the dark. Shoes, clothes, it won’t wash off anything,- said volunteer Ilya.According to him, there is a stench on the beach. As a result, some of the volunteers feel sick - today they did not yet know about the smell and did not stock up on masks. Ilya is preparing for the fact that tomorrow there will be even more work, as there is a strong wind that will bring new fuel oil ashore.-We collected the fuel oil in bags. No one has taken them out yet. The Ministry of Emergency Situations will most likely give some instructions on this matter, but so far there are none. That is, our task for now is simply to localize, collect, drag and cover everything with sand, because the waves are strong, the water can get it all out and take it away overnight,- explains Ilya.The volunteer says, that not only residents of Anapa, but also visitors from other regions who spent the winter here came to the beach to help.-There are still no people. Therefore, of course, we need to help. We also have our own work. Now it's dark, we stopped working. At night everyone will come to their senses a little and tomorrow we will start again, because the water will only erode further and further. The scale here is catastrophic. The state, local businesses, and people need to somehow unite,- says Ilya. Fuel oil contains polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, many of which are proven carcinogens. Breathing fuel oil vapors causes irritation of the respiratory tract, coughing, shortness of breath and can lead to the development of bronchitis, pneumonia and other respiratory diseases. Fuel oil particles entering the lungs can cause fibrosis and other chronic diseases. Direct contact with fuel oil causes dermatitis, eczema and other skin diseases. Some components of fuel oil have neurotoxic properties that affect the nervous system. This can manifest itself in headaches, dizziness, weakness and other neurological symptoms.In the morning, Governor of the Krasnodar Territory Veniamin Kondratiev confirmed, that after the tanker crash -Volgoneft 239- and Volgoneft 212 washed up oil products on the coast. oil products washed ashore. What is known about the person who died as a resultexplosionof Lieutenant General Kirillov?Igor Kirillov born July 13, 1970 in Kostroma. There, in 1991, he graduated from the Kostroma Higher Military Command School of Chemical Defense and the Military Academy of Chemical Defense named after S.K. Timoshenko in 2007. From 1991 to 1995 he served as a platoon commander in the Western Group of Forces in Germany and the Moscow Military District. By 2009, Kirillov had risen to the position of commander of a separate NBC protection brigade, and then continued to serve in the Office of the Chief of the NBC Defense Troops of the Russian Armed Forces. From September 2014 to April 2017, Kirillov headed the Military Academy of Russian Chemical Defense named after S.K. Timoshenko, and in April 2017 he was appointed head of the radiation, chemical and biological defense forces of the RF Armed Forces. Igor Kirillov is called one of the developers of the TOS-2 Tosochka, which was later put into service. This is a flamethrower system using shells with a thermobaric or incendiary warhead.According to data from the patent database of the Federal Institute of Industrial Property, Igor Kirillov is one of the inventors of a set of reagents for detecting the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. During the coronavirus pandemic, Kirillov repeatedly expressedthe opinion that this pandemic is deliberate and the United States is involved in its occurrence. After the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Kirillov stated that a network of biological laboratories was discovered there, and the Ukrainian authorities, under the pretext of fighting Due to Covid, thousands of samples belonging to the -Slavic ethnic group- were sent to the United States with the aim of creating biological weapons. In the blasting of the Kakhovskaya hydroelectric power station dam, Kirillov blamed The Pentagon, which, according to him, was trying to create populations of small insects that could be carriers of dangerous diseases —Ebola fever, hepatitis B, AIDS and severe acute respiratory syndrome.Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov was killed today in Moscow along with his assistant. As he was leaving the entrance, a bomb planted in an electric scooter parked nearby exploded. In the BBC with links to sources they claim that the explosion was an operation of the Ukrainian special services.Kirillov is survived by his wife and two sons. Edition -We Can Explain- note that the eldest son, Ilya, was born in Germany, and the place of registration of members of the Kirillov family in many leaks is Frunzenskaya Embankment 22/2 in Moscow. The building of the Russian Ministry of Defense is located at this address. Shortly before the explosion of the SBU in absentia announced Kirillov suspicion of using chemical weapons against the Ukrainian Armed Forces. -By order of Kirillov, since the beginning of a full-scale war, more than 4.8 thousand cases of the enemy’s use of chemical munitions have been recorded,- the department reported.☮️ Help ASTRA raise money for journalists’ salaries in December: https://t.me/astrapress/69943 Video is too big

Title: The EU is preparing sanctions against the organizers of the hybri...
Description: The EU is preparing sanctions against the organizers of the Kremlin’s -hybrid operations-. Among them are Tina Kandelaki and employees of the presidential administration and the GRUSystem journalists (Radio Liberty project) prepareda partial list of Russians, against whom the European Union is preparing sanctions due to involvement in Russian hybrid operations in Europe and Africa. It will include 16 people and three companies.For example, the head of GC Structura LLC, Nikolai Tupikin, according to EU officials, headed the Doppelganger (-Double-) operation. This is a disinformation campaign launched after the start of the war in Ukraine and is aimed at audiences in the EU and the USA. It was used to publish fake news on websites imitating major international media and other authoritative sources.An employee of the Russian Presidential Administration, Sofya Zakharova, also participated in this campaign, who, among other things, may be associated with projects to discredit the Russian opposition , which for the first time became one of the reasons for the introduction of EU sanctions.The sanctions list, which has not yet been officially published, also included a former TV presenter, deputy general director Gazprom Media Tinatin (Tina) Kandelaki. It is alleged that it is engaged in propaganda justifying Russian aggression in Ukraine, and in the occupied territories its structures replaced Ukrainian TV channels with Russian ones.FSB officer Artem Kureev should be subject to EU sanctions - he launched propaganda projects Rusafro and African Initiative (- African Initiative-), spread disinformation accusing the West of -experiments to create bioweapons-, which talked about -genetically modified mosquitoes-, as well as the fact that Western companies, under the guise of vaccination, allegedly used the African population as a -free clinical base-.Another people on the list: GRU officers Yuri Sizov and Vladimir Lipchenko, who were allegedly involved in the creation of intelligence networks, arson and attacks on critical infrastructure in the EU countries and Ukraine. The sanctions should include GRU military unit 29155, headed by GRU Major General Andrei Averyanov. The unit's employees were associated with a number of European GRU operations. For example, in an investigation by the Czech weekly Respekt and Bellingcat it was said that the Russian military intelligence operation to organize sabotage at weapons depots in the Czech Republic in the fall of 2014 took place under the personal control of Averyanov. Averyanov himself leads operations in Africa to undermine democracy, the draft sanctions say. Russian forces may have mined gold in Mali to finance these operations, the document's authors claim.EU foreign ministers are due to approve the new sanctions list on December 16.

Description: There is a shortage of saline solution in Russian pharmaciesReports of a shortage of saline solution have been coming from the Tyumen, Chelyabinsk, Sverdlovsk, Leningrad regions and Perm Territory since November of this year. -Fontanka- writes that in hospitals in St. Petersburg you have to wait in line for IVs for several months, or look for saline solution yourself. Suppliers have been found who are ready to supply the drug to regions in need. The situation with the re-registration of prices for sodium chloride is under control,- the department said. On Friday morning Roszdravnadzor reported that stocks currently amount to more than 9.4 million packages, -supplies of saline solution to medical organizations and pharmacies continue.- Sodium chloride is included in the list of vital and essential medicines for which fixed prices are set.

According to investigators, they received an anonymous order in the messenger on December 7, and on December 12 they arrived at the potential victim’s house in Kolomna and tried to plant an IED under the driver’s seat of a jeep. Previously in Moscow shot,according to journalist Alexander Nevzorov, deputy general designer of the Mars Design Bureau, Mikhail Shatsky. His death was not officially confirmed.

Title: 🎬 A criminal case was opened against an Iranian singer because o...
Description: A criminal case was opened against an Iranian singer because of an online concert where she sang without a hijabIranian singer Parastu Ahmadi performed in one of the traditional Iranian caravanserais (a resting place for caravans in the Persian Empire), broadcast on her YouTube channel. Parastu was not wearing a hijab and was wearing an evening dress, which is contrary to Iranian laws. After 1979, women in the country also do not have the right to sing in public, so her concert is also a violation of the laws.Before the performance, Ahmadi said: -I want to sing for the people I love. This is a right that I cannot ignore: to sing for the land that I love dearly.-The concert was watched by many viewers, despite the YouTube ban in Iran. After widespread publicity, security agents came to Ahmadi's house with a search, and she was summoned to the Tehran security prosecutor's office for questioning, writes Euronews. A criminal case was opened against the singer and her team for violating morality and the law and lack of permission to conduct an online broadcast of the concert.🌱 Subscribe to ASTRA.
